subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... For the same reason we have been talking about using lexical sets for the vowels: only the North American dialects merge t  d between vowels.  That said,
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> Given the use of QS letters the questions become:
> - When "shutter" and "shudder" are homonyms why not use the same
> letter for them? (we'd need a very good and clear reason not too:
> "because they are spelled that way in TO" is not compelling)

For the same reason we have been talking about using lexical sets
for the vowels: only the North American dialects merge t > d between
vowels. That said, this issue is not nearly as critical as the
vowel issues are.

--
John Cowan http://www.ccil.org/~cowan cowan@...
"After all, would you consider a man without honor wealthy, even if his
Dinar laid end to end would reach from here to the Temple of Toplat?"
"No, I wouldn't", the beggar replied. "Why is that?" the Master asked.
"A Dinar doesn't go very far these days, Master. --Kehlog Albran
Besides, the Temple of Toplat is across the street." The Profit
